pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8207622565/job/22449296573)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8207622565/job/22449296752)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8207622565/job/22449296158)

Thanks!

bors merge

Thanks!

bors merge
Unless I'm missing something, I think this is already true at the level of `UniformOnFun` without more work. That said, we may want a more general result in that setup, so do as you want.
What result is true for `UniformOnFun`?

For ` [{K | IsCompact K}] ` all of your results are true (both the explicit basis and the countably generated uniformity) and shouldn't require much more work. More generally, if `` is an ideal and you have a basis of your ideal, then you have the same basis result for ` [] ` (eventually [UniformOnFun.hasBasis_uniformity_of_basis](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Topology/UniformSpace/UniformConvergenceTopology.html#UniformOnFun.hasBasis_uniformity_of_basis) should be stated this way), hence if `` is a countably generated ideal and ` ` is a countably generated filter then ` [] ` has countably generated uniformity.
Added relevant generalizations.

```suggestion
  refine hs.elim_directed_cover (interior  K) (fun _  isOpen_interior) ?_ ?_
```

```suggestion
   exact Monotone.directed_le fun _ _ h  interior_mono <| K.subset h
```
Do you mean that it will become easier with this? I don't see why, in fact I think it would be fairly straightforward in the current situation? Am I missing something obvious?
We won't need to `import` metric spaces for that result. I can add a temporary file that `import`s enough and prove metrizability there.
Ah, I didn't realize that was an import issue. Yes I think it would be best to add the `PseudoMetrizableSpace` result already in another file, if that's fine for you.
Done.

Why do you assume `HasAntitoneBasis` instead of just `HasBasis`? Of course in a lot of cases you'll get an `HasAntitoneBasis` directly, but in other cases you need to do more work to get it, and I don't see why you'd want to do it?
We already have `HasCountableBasis.isCountablyGenerated`. I'll add `HasBasis.isCountablyGenerated` as well.

I'm aware of `HasCountableBasis.isCountablyGenerated`, but my point was that the `HasBasis` version would be a drop-in replacement for the `HasAntitoneBasis` one, since dot notation should be able to find its way through the `extends`, while you would need some extra glue to use `HasCountableBasis` directly.
Side note: do you know why `UniformSpace.pseudoMetrizableSpace` can be an instance but `UniformSpace.metrizableSpace` cannot?
In Lean 4 it can. In Lean 3 this would lead to a cycle.
Okay I realized the problem is not where I thought. I was thinking of some cycle involving `MetricSpace`, but didn't realize the trouble is `MetrizableSpace -> T0Space`.
As I said above, I think we can just get rid of this lemma since the fact that the basis is antitone has nothing to do with countable generation. Do you have any other use for it?

I found 3 lemmas that can be useful (i.e. that don't output new `HasAntitoneBasis` statements): [Filter.HasAntitoneBasis.tendsto](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/AtTopBot.html#Filter.HasAntitoneBasis.tendsto), [Filter.HasAntitoneBasis.eventually_subset](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/AtTopBot.html#Filter.HasAntitoneBasis.eventually_subset), and [Filter.HasAntitoneBasis.tendsto_smallSets](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Filter/SmallSets.html#Filter.HasAntitoneBasis.tendsto_smallSets). Also, we often have an antitone basis, and in this case we can use the "diagonal" subbasis which can be useful.

Ah yes the diagonal basis is a good point, I should have looked more carefully. So let's keep that indeed. Could you replace `` by any index type satisfying [IsDirected](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Order/Directed.html#IsDirected)?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(UniformSpace/CompactConvergence): prove metrizability
